body_html: The root issue is that L1Loss (along with some other losses) check if the input and target have the same number of elements. What it really should be doing is checking if the input and target have the same shapes. It looks like L1Loss (and most other losses, if not all) don't support broadcasting.
body_text: The root issue is that L1Loss (along with some other losses) check if the input and target have the same number of elements. What it really should be doing is checking if the input and target have the same shapes. It looks like L1Loss (and most other losses, if not all) don't support broadcasting.
body: The root issue is that L1Loss (along with some other losses) check if the input and target have the same number of elements. What it really should be doing is checking if the input and target have the same shapes. It looks like L1Loss (and most other losses, if not all) don't support broadcasting.
